result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R. Lynch Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel R. Lynch Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel R. Lynch Jr. was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Increased Penalty for Elder Person Victim], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
Pay Restitution in the sum TBD plus surcharges. May not have contact with victim.

chargeModifiers.descr: Increased Penalty for Elder Person Victim
Increased Penalty for Elder Person Victim

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R. Lynch Jr.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on January 5, 2023 at 10:00 am before Com. Keating.

3:30 PM 
Defendant Daniel R. Lynch Jr. in court.
Attorney David Patton in court for Daniel R. Lynch Jr.
Attorney Zachary L Brost in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court Reporter:  Sage Smith.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance and victim present in court.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Battery-Increased Penatly for Elder Person Victim;
Found guilty by the court;  Ct 2 was dismissed outright on State's motion. 
Ct 1:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions;
No sentence credit if revoked.
Court costs ordered; restitution ordered.
Restitution hearing requested by the State; def. atty requesting a January date.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Appeal rights given.

03:48 PM
Defendant, Daniel R. Lynch, appeared with Attorney David Patton.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant stated he had drank some alcohol last night.
Court adjourns the plea hearing; Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:10 AM
Defendant, Daniel R. Lynch, appeared with Attorney David Patton.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Matter set over for plea hrg.
State needs time to file amended crim. complt.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  Atty moves to dismiss elder enhancer - Court grants request - enhancer dismissed w/o prejudice.  ts
and witness list filed by the State
